citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
During the period of August to December 2023, there were six occasions where male hamsters were left in enclosures
with female hamsters after the female hamster had given birth, however no adverse incident resulted from the practice.
This practice, which was a change in an existing protocol, had not been approved by the IACUC. Preapproval of
significant changes in a protocol are necessary to insure IACUC oversite and prevent possible harm that could come to
animals in research. Housing of adult hamsters with a female and her nursing litter can lead to the other adult harming or
killing the newborn hamsters. Going forward all significant changes in a protocol must be approved by the IACUC before
their implementation. The protocol was changed on 02/07/2024 and approved by the IACUC to allow for an exception to
regulation 3.28(b)(3)(ii).
Corrected at time of inspection: 12/06/2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
